channel.title: 路透财经
channel.description: 这是一个追踪路透财经news的种子

item.title: 耐克公司警告说，由于全球最大的运动服装制造商为节约成本而缩减特许经营权，2025 财年上半年的收入将以较低的个位数百分比缩水
item.description:
Nike warned that its revenue in the first half of fiscal 2025 would shrink by a low single-digit percentage as the world's largest sportswear maker scales back on franchises to save costs https://t.co/TTSIoJuoVQ pic.twitter.com/FBkTUPJoaA

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.description:

item.title: 日本央行结束长达近十年的负利率政策后，日本企业和消费者正准备应对其对货币和借贷成本的影响
item.description:
Japanese businesses and consumers are bracing for the impact on currencies and borrowing costs after the Bank of Japan ended its nearly decade-long negative interest rate policy https://t.co/ploIk4RKmB pic.twitter.com/QVlvcMoWX4

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 曾经热衷于向前景看好的印度科技企业注入数十亿美元资金的投资者们，现在却开始放慢脚步，开出更少的支票。曾经在市场上声名显赫的新公司，其估值和风头都一落千丈，令他们焦头烂额。
item.description:
Investors, once eager to pump in billions of dollars in promising Indian tech ventures, are now going slow and cutting smaller cheques. They've been burnt by ignominious falls from grace - and valuations - for once-marquee market debutants https://t.co/AGN33Hj37V

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 意大利对人工智能经验和专业知识的需求激增，监管机构发现自己也在争夺这个浅水池中的人才。但相对较低的薪酬、漫长的招聘流程和签证问题阻碍了他们的招聘雄心
item.description:
Demand for AI experience and expertise has surged in Italy, and regulators have found themselves vying for talent from the same shallow pool. But relatively low pay, long hiring processes and visa problems are thwarting their hiring ambitions https://t.co/IdFMeqC5p7

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 日本央行行长上田一夫表示，央行最终将缩减债券购买规模，并允许市场力量决定长期利率走势，这表明他决心稳步推进超宽松货币政策正常化。
item.description:
Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said the central bank will eventually scale back bond purchases and allow market forces to set long-term interest rate moves, signaling his resolve to move steadily towards normalising ultra-loose monetary policy https://t.co/lSdPWR8KWU

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024

item.title: 数百万日本人，从小业主到首次购房者，都在掂量着如何在漫长的通货紧缩岁月之后适应更高的借贷成本。
item.description:
Millions of Japanese, from small business owners to first-time homebuyers, are sizing up how to adapt to higher borrowing costs after the long, lean years of deflation, when prices, wages and the cost of money changed little https://t.co/mRi19lyLE8

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 22, 2024
